Factsheet

Developer:
VESPA
Based in Davis, California
Release date:
June 9, 2021
Platforms:
PC / Mac
Website:
github.com/Panlord/game-power-down
Regular Price:
Free!

Download

Description

It is the dead of night. You have been commissioned by some unknown identity to collect a valuable book from a certain professor at a certain university. The lights are dim, but visibility is decent. No one seems to be around, and everything seems to be going along to your plans until you pick up the book. All the lights shut off. You lose track of where you are. Very low, eerie noises can be heard in the distance. Something’s coming for you. You have a flashlight and your phone (which has been corrupted and now displays a map), but every time you turn something on, you feel something come closer. Will you make your escape, or will you investigate? The user faces a first-person experience in a dark university building. They must traverse the dark hallways to find the book and then escape while “professor” is looking for them. Pieces of lore are scattered around that provide information about the world. Access is provided via a flashlight and the phone map. However, overuse of either will reveal your location to the “professor” who will head there. If the user is caught by the professor, a loud noise and jumpscare ensue.

History

Escape from Kemper is the game we created that serves as our final project game submission for our ECS 189L Gameplay Programming class at UC Davis. Given the prompt "power down," we brainstormed various game ideas until we settled on a basic horror game where the player has escape a dark building while their flashlight slowly runs out of battery and a monster chases them. After several weeks of hard work, we hope you are ready to Escape from Kemper.

Features

  • A dark, spooky map created based off of UC Davis's Kemper Hall
  • A flashlight that slowly runs out of battery
  • A freaky story that you uncover through collecting 20 items scattered throughout the map
  • An angry monster(professor?) that is out for your blood
